title: Why does it seem like US Conservatives are the only group in the world to deny accepted science? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s other fantastic answers here, but - with respect to the other Quorans posting here - I don’t think they go far enough, or stridently enough. So at the risk of stretching some readers’ BN,BR conceptions, I’m going to try and offer a more ‘full-throated’ answer … First, I want to put a descriptive qualification down: I’m going to include the concepts of statistical analysis, and its derivative, risk analysis (aka probability + cost), plus some extremely basic economics, in the family of ‘science’ in this answer. (I think it would be more accurate to use ‘reason’ or ‘logic’ as terms, but we’ll stick with ‘science’.) Second, I’m going to group Americans into two monstrously, unfairly simple generalizations - Conservative (the term OP used) & Liberals - and then make wild generalizations about these groups. This is totally unfair; Americans, even among and within these groups, are wildly diverse & ‘a-la-carte’ with their views … but I’m going to generalize regardless! OK, let’s see who’s actually (ALSO) denying science in America: Genetically Modified Organisms (aka GMOs) … So who’s usually against these? The farmers, on the Prairies, who are overwhelmingly Conservative, and who are actually dealing with real crops? Or the Liberal Hipsters in Cali and NY, who ‘know’ that kale gets born in supermarkets? I know exactly zero farmers who are systematically against GMOs; they all know selective breeding’s been going on forever. Mention GMOs to some Liberals and you’d think it was an alien invasion. And what ‘science’ is there against GMOs? Almost zero. And what benefits? Countless millions saved from more and better food, less pesticides, irrigation, etc, etc. Next time you hear a Liberal wax on about GMOs know that they are directly advocating for the death of millions of their fellow humans.The Anti-Vaccination Crowd … So how are these people voting? Where is Anti-Vaxx ‘a thing’? Mostly in CA, WA and among affluent coastal suburbs - meaning with Liberals. Again, the science here is essentially ironclad: The harm caused, to an infinitesimally small number of recipients, is directly contrasted with the actual children who die of preventable and curable diseases every year. The Press loves promoting a certain blonde HS dropout, who was briefly a third-rate TV personality, about how she “feels” vaccines are linked to her son’s (tragic) development problems. BUT do you ever hear the Press interview the mother of the child who actually died from whooping cough? The Anti-Vaxx’ers are usually Liberals, and again have much to answer for, since their junk idea is actually killing their fellow Americans, sometimes even their own kids.Homeopathy & Aromatherapy … Sorry to tell you, but: these service provider’s clienteles are not well attended by Conservatives. It’s the Liberals who are spending their weekends doing “a cleanse” on the misbegotten idea that there’s somehow “toxins” secretly hiding in their body, and the solution to this perceived problem all rests with a blender and a toilet. There’s been exactly zero scientific studies showing that spending your whole weekend in the bathroom is any better than a placebo. Likewise, having “nice smells” around you has cured exactly nothing! The whole concept of “smells heal (and hurt)” is hilarious, since that idea was at the cutting edge of science … in the Middle Ages!; since the Enlightenment, not so much. Liberals: reason more, so you can $hit less!Oil pipelines … Again, who exactly is promoting these? Conservatives. Why? Because they’re safer! Announce a ‘site plan’ for an oil pipeline and watch every Liberal for hundreds of miles go nuts. Sure there’s lots of basic NIMBYism going on here, but many Liberals are systematically, irretrievably against pipelines, always and everywhere —- because you know: transporting the stuff by rail is only MANY TIMES riskier. Plus, while the Liberals are essentially advocating for much-more-dangerous transportation options, Daryl Hannah might show up and address the crowd! … direct from her jet plane … ‘powered by 100% organic kale’? [Also, don’t like our carbon footprint? Well then, listen to the Liberals advocate for the government making ‘other people’ use less gasoline! After which they all drive home to their McMansions in the Suburbs.]Nuclear Power … Liberal: “We need a cleaner future, less reliant on fossil fuels!” Conservative: “OK, let’s build some reactors; they’re clean and provide lots of cheap power for generations.” Liberal: “#%$^&*!!! Never!!!” Conservative: “What do you do for a living?” Liberal: “I’m an environmental organizer!” Conservative: “Where’d the electricity for your LapTop come from?” Liberal: <silence>……….. Nuff Said.TLDR: Sorry, the Conservatives don’t have a monopoly on ‘science denial’, not by a long shot!! Liberals have their own things going in this sphere too.  I’d also like to add an aside, as an atheist, and in defense of SOME conservatives: It seems to me that the vast number of ‘science deniers’ among Conservatives in the US flow from the Religious, who tend to electorally herd with Conservatives. I would argue that these people are ‘science deniers’ not because they are conservative, but because they are religious. Some think that ‘Science’ and ‘Faith’ are separate, unlinked matters. I totally disagree! I think Science and Faith are incompatible, irreconcilable and antithetical ideas. And because they are, wherever science advances, faith must retreat. Religious Faith belongs to the ancient, ignorant, infantile part of our collective history, when we simply didn’t know better; Science, through its methodology, and by repeated proofs and verifiable evidence, offers the prospect of actual advancement of human knowledge. Consequently, the Religious view science - rightly! - as a direct threat to, and assault upon, their Faithful beliefs! And from there it’s only a short, all-too-human step into science denial. The ‘deniers’ aren’t Conservatives, as you assert; but instead are the Religious, who are threatened by science itself.

Interesting question. First, some clarification. US conservatives are most definitely not the only group in the world to engage in science denial. Try peddling evolution to a fundamentalist Muslim. Nor are they the only group in the United States. Try convincing a crystal-wearing new ager that vaccines are safe. Still, the US conservatives are a troubling case for a number of reasons. Unlike anti-vaxers, they actually have a huge impact on public policy. Global environmental issues? They think it’s all a hoax. Or at least they say they do. Why? Because of their proclivities in a couple of areas. First, they’re pro-business. Whatever makes Exxon happy is what they’re for. And they can rely on well-funded reelection campaigns as a result. There’s simply no money in environmentalism. And money is what makes Washington go-round. Second, they never get tired of hippie punching. If those granola-eating pot smokers are for it, we’re against it. Third, solving this kind of problem will require international cooperation. They don’t like this. America goes it alone, listens to no one, and never does anything outside of its own narrow interests. That’s how they prefer it. There are other issues where they can get weird. Like when you show them the science behind making free, high quality contraception available. Unwanted pregnancies drop precipitiously. And so does abortion. You’d think they’d be all over it, passing the collection plate in church to fund such programs in their towns and cities. But no. Not interested in the slightest. This case is a little different. They’re not actually interested in abortions or fetuses or “life.” If they were, they’d be onboard. When you ask them why they are not, they say things like “it sends the wrong message” and “actions should have consequences.” What that means is that they’re more interested in policing the sexuality of young women than they are in “babies” or whatever they’re on about. Totally disingenuous about what they want and care about. Which is why the science of the issue isn’t relevant to them. The science doesn’t show how to more effectively slut-shame. It shows how to prevent abortions. So they’re not interested.
